alert.note: Alert for Duchesne; Wasatch (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 11 at 1:44PM MDT until June 11 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Dollar Ridge Burn Scar in... West Central Duchesne County in northern Utah... Southeastern Wasatch County in northern Utah... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 144 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Dollar Ridge burn scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starvation Reservoir and Strawberry Reservoir, as well as the Promised Land Resort area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: A debris flow is expected to impact the Strawberry River corridor from Strawberry Reservoir to Starvation Reservoir. People living in this area should take action to ensure their safety! Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
